result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Joint and several.  lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription. 

Defendant shall have no contact with any Menards store in Washington County. 

Defendant shall have no contact with the co-defendants: Clay Rich and Kevin Rich.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael W Brown appeared by phone.  Attorney Tsz-King Tse in court for Michael W Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of phone conferencing.  On a plea to Ct 1, State moves to dismiss and read in Ct 2; free to argue. Guilty plea entered on Ct 1;  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1, Defendant is convicted and sentenced; On motion of the State Ct 2 is dismissed and read in. State confirms victim rights compliance.  Argument on sentencing and statements made by defendant.
Arrangements made for def to appear by Zoom from RCI for hearing on 10-12-22

Defendant Michael W Brown appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Tsz-King Tse in court for Michael W Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def appears by video, but cannot hear.  Court adj.

Information rec'd and reading waived, not guilty pleas entered and accepted. Defendant has pending cases in Ozaukee Co and requests time to try and negotiate.

Court questions def, accepts waiver and binds def over; State to file Information.
